hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via Futures Basis Recovery
hypothesis_content.statement: During BEAR regimes, when quarterly futures basis recovers from negative to positive while spot price remains flat (±3%) for 3 days, and cumulative volume delta turns positive for 2 consecutive days, regime transitions to NEUTRAL within 5 trading days with 68% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Basis recovery during consolidation indicates diminishing selling pressure in derivatives. Positive volume delta suggests accumulation. Neutral funding prevents short squeeze false signals. This combination often marks bear exhaustion before full bullish reversal.
entry_conditions: BTC quarterly futures basis crosses from negative to positive
Cumulative volume delta > 0 for 2 consecutive days

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Basis returns to negative and price breaks below consolidation low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Basis recovery fails to predict NEUTRAL transition in >40% of cases, or leads to continued BEAR regime despite all conditions.
